page.title: 11A FAMILY OF FOUR AT CATLOWDY
page.content: We grow our own vegetables.Husband shoots rabbits and pheasants on our land.We keep hens for eggs and meat.I make our own wholemeal bread,cakes and biscuits.Milk & newspapers delivered. We make one or two trips a week to Longtown by car and buy things we don't produce ourselves e.g.petrol,coffee,flour,dairy foods,cleaning materials & some meat. We also buy things at our local Post Office/shop and draw Family Allowance there.We only shop in Carlisle if ee have an additional reason for going.We always try to achieve several objectives when we go out in the car as petrol is expensive.Although supermarkets in Carlisle are generally cheaper than in Longtown,the round trip is almost forty miles.For corn for the hens,fence posts,building material,we go to Longtown or Carlisle
